questions.question: Who is responsible for instigating training programmes, the aim of which is to minimize the opportunities for unlawful interference with flights?
options: The Authority of the State of Registration
The Authority of the State of the operator
The operator
The law enforcement agency with responsibility under the law of the state of registration of the aeroplane

questions.question: Who is responsible for reporting acts of unlawful interference?
options: The commander or the operator
The ATCU for the airspace in which the event occurred
Any member of the flight crew
Any person on board the aeroplane

questions.question: The operator is responsible for ensuring that a search procedure of an aeroplane is published. By what means are these procedures published?
options: In the operations manual
As a checklist
As a standing order or standard operating procedure
As an enclosure to the aeroplane handbook

questions.question: After an act of unlawful interference a report is to be made. When and to whom?
options: Within 10 days and to the Authority of the state of registry
Immediately and to the Authority of the state of the airspace in which the event occurred
Without delay, to the designated local Authority and the Authority of the state of registration
Without delay, to the designated local Authority and the Authority of the state of the operator
questions.solution: Without delay, to the designated local Authority and the Authority of the state of the operator

questions.question: When an unlawful interference occurs, the state over which the event occurs is required by international law to take adequate measures to protect passengers and crew. Such measures will include:
options: the provision of a fully functioning ATC system and a landing clearance if required
if the aeroplane lands, it is to be disabled to prevent subsequent take-off
facilities for the armed forces of the state of registry (if not the same as the state in which the aeroplane has landed) to storm the aeroplane by force
notification to ICAO that the event has occurred
questions.solution: the provision of a fully functioning ATC system and a landing clearance if required

questions.question: If it is suspected that a bomb is on board an aeroplane the measures that should be taken are designed to:
options: disable the device
find out what will trigger the device
prevent knowledge of the device on board getting to the passengers
locate and move the device to the 'least-risk' location and apply as much padding as possible
questions.solution: locate and move the device to the 'least-risk' location and apply as much padding as possible
